data.name: BtnSkipChapter
data.value: Skip chapter

data.name: ChoiceOfAlgorithm
data.value: Choice of the algorithm

data.name: ChoiceOfAlgorithmToolTop
data.value: At this point one of the algorithms contained in the list can be selected. This algorithm can be examined by differential cryptanalysis.

data.name: Cipher1
data.value: Cipher 1: 16 bit blocksize, 2 subkeys, the key consists of 32 bit

data.name: Cipher2
data.value: Cipher 2: 16 bit blocksize, 4 subkeys, the key consists of 64 bit

data.name: Cipher3
data.value: Cipher 3: 16 bit blocksize, 6 subkeys, the key consists of 96 bit

data.name: Cipher4
data.value: Cipher 4: 4 bit blocksize, 4 subkeys, the key consists of 16 bit

data.name: DescriptionContent1
data.value: In the settings of this component, you can switch between the tutorials. The following is a short description of the ciphers of the individual parts of the tutorial:

data.name: DescriptionContent2
data.value: Tutorial 1 uses cipher 1 of the ToyChiffren component. This cipher works on 16 bit blocks and uses two round keys. One encryption round is executed. In this tutorial two unknown 16 bit round keys are restored.

data.name: DescriptionContent3
data.value: Tutorial 2 uses cipher 2 of the ToyChiffren component. This cipher works on 16 bit blocks and uses four round keys. Three encryption rounds are executed. In this tutorial four unknown 16 bit roundkeys are restored.

data.name: DescriptionContent4
data.value: Tutorial 3 uses cipher 3 of the ToyChiffren component. This cipher works on 16 bit blocks and uses six round keys. Five encryption rounds are executed. In this tutorial six unknown 16 bit round keys are restored.

data.name: DescriptionHeader
data.value: Description of the Tutorials

data.name: DescriptionSubHeader1
data.value: Tutorial 1

data.name: DescriptionSubHeader2
data.value: Tutorial 2

data.name: DescriptionSubHeader3
data.value: Tutorial 3

data.name: ExpectedDifferential
data.value: Expected difference

data.name: ExpectedDifferentialToolTip
data.value: This difference describes the expected value that should occur with a high probability at the previously specified position ( round, SBox).

data.name: MessageCount
data.value: Count of messages

data.name: MessageCountToolTip
data.value: The number of messages specifies the number of messages the oracle should generate.

data.name: OverviewContent1
data.value: Welcome to the differential cryptanalysis tutorial. This method for the analysis of turn-based symmetric block ciphers aims at recovering single bits up to complete lap keys. This procedure was published in 1991 by the two Israeli researchers, Eli Biham and Adi Shamir.

data.name: OverviewContent2
data.value: In this tutorial this procedure is presented in three parts. Part one teaches the basic idea of differential cryptanalysis by analyzing a cipher with an encryption round. Part two expands this idea to three encryption rounds. In part three the knowledge is deepened by increasing the complexity of the cipher to 5 encryption rounds.

data.name: OverviewContent3
data.value: In the configuration of this component the different parts of the tutorial can be selected.

data.name: OverviewContent4
data.value: Have fun trying out and breaking the ciphers!

data.name: OverviewHeader
data.value: Differential Cryptanalysis Tutorial

data.name: Path
data.value: Path of the characteristic

data.name: PathToolTip
data.value: These values describe the flow of the difference values through a cipher.

data.name: PluginCaption
data.value: DCA PathFinder

data.name: PluginTooltip
data.value: The DCA PathFinder component searches for differentials in a symmetric block cipher depending on parameters specified by the user.
